According to the applicant , the demonstration of DATE was peaceful and was held on DATE of the NORP intervention in GPE in support of the missing persons and to protest against human - rights violations . In the course of the demonstration the applicant was seized by the hair and violently beaten on the head , back and bottom and assaulted by NORP military personnel and/or other personnel acting under NORP control . They continually grabbed hold of her breasts . She was dragged to a bus through a crowd that spat and swore at her and then taken to the so - called “ FAC ” with other women . On her arrival there the applicant was searched and forced to sit on the floor . The toilet facilities were filthy and she was refused water . CARDINAL ORG soldiers were present , but were not allowed to note down the names of the detainees . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was interrogated in the garage for TIME . She refused to sign a statement , which was written in NORP . The applicant and the other detainees were provided with food and at the same time were photographed and filmed by a television crew .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was taken to court and remanded in custody for DATE . She was transferred to FAC , where she was kept in a cell with another woman . The conditions of detention were appalling and there were not enough beds for all the women detainees ; during the night she and the other detainees were harassed by the guards .

CARDINAL . In the course of her detention , the guards constantly made a lot of noise both during DATE and at TIME , repeatedly entered the cells and turned on the lights . On CARDINAL occasions the applicant had to sign documents written in NORP in order to get her personal effects back . CARDINAL . ORG to the head , concussion . The patient had diffuse haematomas to the head and mainly in her hair and was complaining of headache and dizziness . The patient seemed to be in a very bad shape and had a lot of phobias .

CARDINAL . Contusion of the right forearm . The patient wore an elastic bandage on her right forearm and was complaining mainly of pain with movements in the extensor and flexor . I removed the bandage and she had a haematoma in the area of the round extensor .

Ever since then and until DATE the patient has been suffering mainly from pain in the neck , particularly in DATE . During these attacks she takes her medicines and the problems disappear . This is due to the weakness of the muscles of the nape caused to her old injury .
As regards the problems resulting from her concussion , her phobias and her psychological problems , she is being treated by a specialist colleague .

From an orthopaedic point of view , I recommend that she takes her medicines during attacks and that she swims in DATE in order to strengthen her muscular system . This will help her to have rarer and milder attacks of neck pain . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant produced a photograph of herself with a bandage on her right arm . This photograph was allegedly taken on her return home after her release by the authorities of the “ GPE ” ( the “ GPE ” ) .

CARDINAL . The Government alleged that the applicant had participated in a violent demonstration with the aim of inflaming anti - NORP sentiment . The demonstrators , supported by the NORP - Cypriot administration , were demanding that the “ GPE ” in GPE should be dismantled . Some carried NORP flags , clubs , knives and wire - cutters . They were acting in a provocative manner and shouting abuse . The demonstrators were warned in NORP and LANGUAGE that unless they dispersed they would be arrested in accordance with the laws of the “ GPE ” . The applicant was arrested by the NORP - NORP police after crossing the ORG buffer zone and entering the area under NORP - Cypriot control . The NORP - NORP police intervened in the face of the manifest inability of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and ORG in GPE to contain the incursion and its possible consequences .

CARDINAL . No force was used against demonstrators who did not intrude into the “ GPE ” border area and , in the case of demonstrators who were arrested for violating the border , no more force was used than was reasonably necessary in the circumstances in order to arrest and detain the persons concerned . No one was ill - treated . It was possible that some of the demonstrators had hurt themselves in the confusion or in attempting to scale barbed wire or other fencing . Had the NORP police , or anyone else , assaulted or beaten any of the demonstrators , the ORG Secretary General would no doubt have referred to this in his report to ORG .

She pleaded not guilty , but did not give evidence and declined to use the available judicial remedies . She was asked if she required assistance from a lawyer registered in the “ TRNC ” , but refused and did not ask for legal representation . Interpretation services were provided at the trial by qualified interpreters . All the proceedings were translated into NORP .

CARDINAL . The judgment was given in the presence of the accused and of an interpreter , who was reminded of his oath . The trial judge noted the following :
( i ) the accused did not accept the charges against them and stated that they did not wish to use the services of a lawyer registered in the “ GPE ” ;

( vi ) the accused had been told that they could cross - examine witnesses in turn and , if they wished , choose one of their number to cross - examine the witnesses on behalf of all the accused ; however , they did not do so ; some of the accused , including the applicant , put questions to the prosecution witnesses ; most of the accused women did not make use of their right of cross - examination ;

( v ) the applicant made the following statement : “ I consider our arrest as illegal , because we were arrested while we were on a territory which , however you look at it , is NORP , by troops we do not recognise . ( vi ) some of the other women accused gave statements , declaring that the demonstration was peaceful , that they had not carried weapons and that they did not recognise the “ GPE ” as a valid ORG ;

( vii ) relying on the statements of the prosecution witnesses , the “ GPE ” ORG came to the conclusion that the accused had crossed the borders of the “ GPE ” at an unapproved entry point and without permission and had resisted by various means the ORG and NORP forces which had tried to stop them ; the statements made by some of the accused were mainly of a political nature and did not undermine the statements of the prosecution witnesses ;
( viii ) the prosecution had proved its case beyond reasonable doubt , so that the accused were guilty on both counts ;

( ix ) in deciding on the sentence , the “ GPE ” ORG had taken into account the seriousness of the offence and the fact that the accused had shown no remorse and continued to deny the validity of the “ GPE ” .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW reads as follows :

“ Where CARDINAL or more persons assembled with intent to commit an offence , or , being assembled with intent to carry out some common purpose , conduct themselves in such a manner as to cause persons in the neighbourhood to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace , or will by such assembly needlessly and without any reasonable occasion provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace they are an unlawful assembly .
It is immaterial that the original assembling was lawful if , being assembled , they conduct themselves with a common purpose in such a manner as aforesaid .

When an unlawful assembly has begun to execute the purpose , whether of a public or of a private nature , for which it assembled by a breach of the peace and to the terror of the public , the assembly is called a riot , and the persons assembled are said to be riotously assembled . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , any person who takes part in an unlawful assembly is guilty of a misdemeanour and liable to imprisonment for DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Criminal Code provides :

“ Any person who carries in public without lawful occasion any offensive arm or weapon in such a manner as to cause terror to any person is guilty of a misdemeanour , and is liable to imprisonment for DATE , and his arm or weapons shall be forfeited . ”
